perturbation.changed_text:
(h)
Language:
It is the Parties desire and agreement that this Agreement and all Exhibits and associated documentation be drafted in English. Les Parties
conviennent que la présente convention et tous les documents s’y rattachant, soient rédigés en anglais.

(f)
Governing Law:
This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed and enforced in accordance with, the laws in force in the Province of Ontario
(excluding any conflict of laws rule or principle which might refer such construction to the laws of another jurisdiction). The Parties hereto
agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of the Province of Ontario and waive any objection relating to improper venue or
forum non conveniens to the conduct of any proceeding in any such court.
perturbation.explanation: The governing law clause has been moved from its logical position to be placed immediately after the language clause at the end of the 'Miscellaneous' section. This placement is misleading because it is not clearly identified as a governing law provision, which is typically placed at or near the beginning or end of the agreement, not buried in the middle of 'Miscellaneous' clauses. The relocation reduces its prominence and discoverability, making it more difficult for a party to readily ascertain the applicable law.
